close_50_sma.name: 50 SMA
close_50_sma.usage: Identify trend direction and serve as dynamic support/resistance.
close_50_sma.tips: It lags price; combine with faster indicators for timely signals.

close_200_sma.name: 200 SMA
close_200_sma.usage: Confirm overall market trend and identify golden/death cross setups.
close_200_sma.tips: It reacts slowly; best for strategic trend confirmation rather than frequent trading entries.

close_10_ema.name: 10 EMA
close_10_ema.usage: Capture quick shifts in momentum and potential entry points.
close_10_ema.tips: Prone to noise in choppy markets; use alongside longer averages for filtering false signals.

macd.name: MACD
macd.description: Computes momentum via differences of EMAs.
macd.usage: Look for crossovers and divergence as signals of trend changes.
macd.tips: Confirm with other indicators in low-volatility or sideways markets.

macds.name: MACD Signal
macds.description: An EMA smoothing of the MACD line.
macds.usage: Use crossovers with the MACD line to trigger trades.
macds.tips: Should be part of a broader strategy to avoid false positives.

macdh.name: MACD Histogram
macdh.description: Shows the gap between the MACD line and its signal.
macdh.usage: Visualize momentum strength and spot divergence early.
macdh.tips: Can be volatile; complement with additional filters in fast-moving markets.

rsi.name: RSI
rsi.description: Measures momentum to flag overbought/oversold conditions.
rsi.usage: Apply 70/30 thresholds and watch for divergence to signal reversals.
rsi.tips: In strong trends, RSI may remain extreme; always cross-check with trend analysis.

boll.name: Bollinger Middle
boll.description: A 20 SMA serving as the basis for Bollinger Bands.
boll.usage: Acts as a dynamic benchmark for price movement.
boll.tips: Combine with the upper and lower bands to effectively spot breakouts or reversals.

boll_ub.name: Bollinger Upper Band
boll_ub.description: Typically 2 standard deviations above the middle line.
boll_ub.usage: Signals potential overbought conditions and breakout zones.
boll_ub.tips: Confirm signals with other tools; prices may ride the band in strong trends.

boll_lb.name: Bollinger Lower Band
boll_lb.description: Typically 2 standard deviations below the middle line.
boll_lb.tips: Use additional analysis to avoid false reversal signals.

atr.name: ATR
atr.description: Averages true range to measure volatility.
atr.usage: Set stop-loss levels and adjust position sizes based on current market volatility.
atr.tips: It's a reactive measure, so use it as part of a broader risk management strategy.

vwma.name: VWMA
vwma.description: A moving average weighted by volume.
vwma.usage: Confirm trends by integrating price action with volume data.
vwma.tips: Watch for skewed results from volume spikes; use in combination with other volume analyses.

mfi.name: MFI
mfi.description: The Money Flow Index is a momentum indicator that uses both price and volume to measure buying and selling pressure.
mfi.usage: Identify overbought (>80) or oversold (<20) conditions and confirm the strength of trends or reversals.
mfi.tips: Use alongside RSI or MACD to confirm signals; divergence between price and MFI can indicate potential reversals.
